com.zephyr.internal

Interface CommMiddleMan

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    I2CComm, SerialPortComm, SPIComm

    public interface CommMiddleMan
    This interface acts as a middle man between the 3 communication protocols that we can use to communicate with the Pixy cam. This is done to "abstractify" the process of communicating with the Camera without to much work involved.
    Author:
    Bradley Bickford

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      java.lang.Byte readByte()
      Reads a byte from the communication device type.
      java.lang.Short readShort()
      Reads a short (2 bytes) from the communication device type.
      void write(byte[] bytes)
      Writes a series of bytes to the communication device type.
      void write(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
      Writes an NIO ByteBuffer object to the communication device type.

    • Method Detail

      • readByte

        java.lang.Byte readByte()
        Reads a byte from the communication device type. For the most part, the only thing that this is used for is re-synchronizing the the bytes coming from the Pixy should we start pulling data out of order
        Returns:
        The byte that was read, returns null if the read fails

      • readShort

        java.lang.Short readShort()
        Reads a short (2 bytes) from the communication device type. This gets used the most, as the data that comes from the Pixy is all shorts.
        Returns:
        The short that was read, returns null if the read fails

      • write

        void write(byte[] bytes)
        Writes a series of bytes to the communication device type.
        Parameters:
        bytes - The bytes to write

      • write

        void write(java.nio.ByteBuffer buffer)
        Writes an NIO ByteBuffer object to the communication device type. This is used the most because it makes it easier to break down the bytes in a short a little easier, the only issue being that ByteBuffers do require slightly more memory and processing overhead to work with because they are Objects and not primitive types
        Parameters:
        buffer - The ByteBuffer to write
